results.title: No harm in logging
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shot in the timbergetting areas of Australia, this film outlines the practical precautions taken to make the timber logging industry less hazardous.

results.title: Trapper Murphy
results.creator_credit: Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Describes the menace to sheep of dingoes and foxes in the Bogong High Plains in Victoria and shows something of the way in which they are being exterminated. Includes a shot of dingoes actually killing sheep at night.

Please be advised: this film includes scenes of animals being hunted and destroyed which may be distressing to viewers.

results.title: Mountain man
results.creator_credit: Terry Ohlsson and Ford Film Unit
results.brief_description: The 1964 Monte Carlo rally seen through the eyes of champion rally driver Vic Elford. With his partner David Stopne, driving a Cortina, Elford emerged from hazards of dust and fog, blinding sunlight and driving rain as winner of the touring category, with a class victory and a coveted Coupes des Alpes.

results.title: Such a stupid way to die
results.creator_credit: Philip McDonald, David H. Fowler and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: The biggest single killer in the mountains is accidental hypothermia - exposure to cold. This dramatised case study of five people going for a weekend tramp details why it is such a stupid way to die when one of the party suffers severe exposure. This program provides the reasons why he died and what could have prevented his unnecessary death.

results.title: Egyptian villagers
results.brief_description: Examines the village and family life in a small Egyptian farming community, and the future for those who live in villages throughout the country. Illustrates how education brings social change, and the blend of ancient and modern farming methods and patterns.

results.title: Jet pilot
results.creator_credit: Joseph Koenig, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film showing how the introduction of jet travel changed traditional ideas of space and time. The jet pilot in this film sped from northern cold to tropical heat in only a few hours. The film is a dramatic illustration of how high speed-travel shrinks the world and brings people together. An Air Canada plane is featured. (Award: Columbus)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joseph Koenig, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Silicon factor
results.brief_description: The silicon chip has become cheaper and has doubled in sophistication each year. The film looks at what it is, how it works, how it is made, and at its mushrooming applications. Some idea of what goes on inside the “black box” of the microcomputer is given by use of animated cartoon film. Finally we are asked how far computer controlled machines can go in imitating human functions.

results.title: The Work of ice
results.creator_credit: Boulton-Hawker Films and E F V A
results.brief_description: Some of the landforms associated with glacial erosion and deposition are shown in this film designed for school pupils aged 9-13. The French Alps, North Wales and East Yorkshire are depicted and the various landforms such as glaciers, moraines and aretes are explained.

results.title: Water for life and living
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson and Cine Service Productions
results.brief_description: The recreational facilities established by the Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works around its reservoirs through its beautification program provide ideal surroundings for picnickers and the film shows the attraction provided, as well as some stages of construction of the Cardinia Reservoir. Narrated by Geoff Raymond.

results.title: Smoking and kids
results.creator_credit: Bryon Meyers, Morley Skolnek and Sandler Institutional Films
results.brief_description: Many children are caught up in peer pressures that induce them to drink, eat, inhale or inject substances that may harm them. This film provides an opportunity to bring some of the children’s problems into the open, and to think about alleviating them.
